title: 7 Haitian Brands You Need To Up Your Fashion & Beauty Game
description: Haiti's history is filled with vibrant cultural traditions and a spirit of resilience, marked by both periods of massive prosperity and profound struggle. The once-thriving Saint-Domingue was a key producer of sugar, coffee, textile production and much more. However, the country experienced a devastating transition following its independence from France in 1804. Despite the challenges of political instability, natural disasters, and economic hardship that still persist, Haiti's creative pulse remains unshaken. Today, a new generation of Haitian creatives, including designers, makeup artists, and beauty entrepreneurs, are making their mark on the global stage—blending heritage with innovation. While many brands are taking the industry by storm, here are seven dynamic Haitian fashion and beauty brands that reflect the island's creative Caribbean flair and heritage, shaping its promising future built on its rich, complex past.Designed by Haitian-American fashion designer Dayanne Danier, Bien Abyé (which means "Well Dressed" in French Creole) offers a variety of handcrafted detailed accessories made by artisans in Haiti. Whether you're looking for scarves, facemasks, headbands or handbags, Danier prides herself on showcasing her creative inspiration through her work, drawing from her Creole roots and Haiti's one-of-a-kind architectural legacy. Bien Abyé Garden View Silk Scarf, $175.00, available at Nordstrom.Bien Abyé Garden View Silk Scarf, $, available at NordstromEstablished in 2013, Fanm Mon celebrates Haitian heritage through vibrant, beautifully crafted clothing. Their designs not only feature detailed embroidery and rich colors, but each piece tells a unique story inspired by Haiti's natural beauty and cultural traditions. The brand is also deeply committed to ethical production, which further adds to the powerful connection between the garments and their wearers.Fanm Mon Kelly Dress $229.00, available at Fanm Mon.Fanm Mon https://fanmmon.com/products/kelly?variant=408045511640, $, available at Fanm MonDeux Mains isn't just making beautiful leather goods; they're changing lives in Haiti. The company trains and employs local artisans, giving them skills and a fair wage, so your purchase is helping build a stronger community. Their designs are also aesthetically pleasing, showcasing great craftsmanship and quality. Deux Mains Wiline Horn Earrings, $75.00, available at Wolf & Badger.Deux Mains https://www.wolfandbadger.com/us/wiline-horn-earrings/, $, available at Wolf & BadgerIf you're looking for wearable art that sparks meaningful conversations about Black history and culture, look no further than Pyer Moss. Kerby Jean-Raymond is the creative force behind the brand, which is known for innovative shows and pushing the envelope with its designs to tell powerful stories that reflect historical references to Black identity. It's no wonder why major retailers such as Reebok previously joined forces with the Haitian-American fashion label. Pyer Moss Cropped Logo Turtleneck Top, $47.99, available at Saks Fifth Avenue.Pyer Moss https://www.saksfifthavenue.com/product/pyer-moss-x-ree, $, available at Saks Fifth AvenueAromatic Perfume Oils was created by Tatiana Fortune with the promise of cruelty-free, phthalate-free, and alcohol-free ingredients. The company is known for a product line that is carefully formulated with research-backed ingredients. With each product Fortune infuses a rich spirit of empowerment and cultural richness. Aromatic Perfume Oils, Significance Perfume Oil, $32.00, available at Aromatic Perfume Oils.Aromatic Perfume Oils https://aromaticperfumeoils.com/collections/perfumeoils, $, available at Aromatic Perfume OilsFashion designer Stella Jean, known as the "Bridge Connector," has achieved massive success and widespread acclaim. Born to an  Italian father and a Haitian mother, her designs embody multiculturalism, blending bold patterns and classic tailoring to achieve a perfectly fitted aesthetic. Stella Jean Embroidered Short-Sleeve Shift Minidress, $374.99, available at Saks Fifth Avenue.Stella Jean https://www.saksfifthavenue.com/product/stella-jean-emb, $, available at Saks Fifth AvenueKreyòl Essence (KE) is an eco-friendly brand that uses indigenous ingredients from Caribbean farms with clinically backed scalp and skin care products, specifically from Haiti. The brand's product formulations focus on hair loss, eczema, and dryness while achieving results extending from glowing skin to growing natural, healthy hair. Kreyòl Essence Haitian Black Castor Oil - Rosemary Mint, $20.00, available at Ulta Beauty.Kreyol Essence https://www.ulta.com/p/haitian-black-castor-oil-rosemar, $, available at Ulta BeautyLike what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?24 Caribbean-Owned Fashion Brands To Shop NowNew Publisher Specializes In Black Fashion HistoryThe Coolest Black-Owned Beauty Brands To Try ASAP
author: Dontaira Terrell

title: You Can Finally Shop This Beloved Australian Sunscreen In The U.S.
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. For as long as a global beauty ecosystem has existed (so, like, for a long time), there’s been a red-hot beauty brand (usually skincare) that Americans clamor to get their hands on at any cost. In the decade I’ve worked in beauty, I’ve seen editors smuggle various international lotions and potions stateside to eager beauty obsessives; — France’s iconic Bioderma micellar water (now available at Amazon, Target, and other major retailers), Japan’s Hada Labo hydrating essence, and more recently, Australia’s Ultra Violette sunscreen.  What’s the Ultra Violette hype that has us bribing friends going Down Under to stash tubes in their checked bags? For starters, the Aussies know their sunscreen — they kind of have to. Australia gets some of the highest UV exposure on Earth (without getting too science-y, it has to do with the continent’s proximity to the equator, positioning it closer to the sun, especially during summer). As such, Australian SPF is subject to stricter regulations and testing than in the U.S. The result? High-quality sunscreen you can trust.  But that doesn’t mean serious sunscreen can’t also be fun and luxurious— something Ultra Violette founders (and beauty industry veterans) Ava Matthews and Bec Jefferd were keenly aware of. Their vision: an assortment of sunscreen formulations that feel more like your beloved skincare essentials. From hydrating (but never greasy) Supreme Screen to the soft-matte Velvet Screen (my pick of the bunch), Ultra Violette had something for everyone — and now, everyone can shop the brand online and in-store nationwide at Sephora. Below, our beauty editors wax poetic about the UV formulas they’re stocking up on. DashDividers_1_500x100 Supreme Screen SPF 50 Facial Sunscreen, $36 “Australian sunscreen formulas and textures are unlike anything I’ve ever come across. Aside from Fave Fluid (which sadly isn’t available in the US yet) one of my absolute favorites is the Supreme Screen SPF 50 Facial Sunscreen Moisturizer and Primer. The abundance of five-star reviews speaks for itself. It’s so featherlight that it feels like I’m wearing nothing at all— great for my oily skin. It sinks in quickly and leaves behind just a hint of dewiness, making my complexion look healthy and radiant. I’m on the receiving end of compliments whenever I wear it — I even dab a little on my lips because it doesn’t leave that unpleasant bitter taste or smell. I’ve gone through countless tubes and don’t plan on stopping anytime soon.” — Jacqueline Kilikita, Beauty Director “I’m very picky about my SPFs, so when I find one I like, I stick with it. That’s exactly happened with Ultra Violette’s Supreme Screen — I’ve been using it every day since picking it up last year. It’s creamy, moisturizing, and perfect for my dry skin, thanks to squalane and pentavitin, which lock in hydration.. On hot summer days, I skip moisturizer entirely and use this alone — it leaves a soft, satin finish with no white cast or pilling. Plus, I love that it protects from both UVA and UVB rays. The Aussies just know what they’re doing with sun defense!” — Esther Newman, Affiliate Writer Future Screen SPF 50 Blurring Mineral Sunscreen, $36 “Velvet Screen has officially ruined me for sunscreen, possibly forever. Many products claim to lend filter-like effects to skin, but only few actually deliver —  this one does, with the bonus of SPF 50. I have oily, acne-prone skin, and not only did this not piss off my complexion, but it actually felt really nice on – no drying or pilling, like other shine-absorbing SPFs I’ve tried. Velvet Screen looks great solo and doubles as an excellent makeup primer, leaving my skin softly matte, not flat(te). I can’t believe I’m saying this after only a few weeks of testing, but if I could only use one face sunscreen for the rest of my life, it would probably be this one.” — Karina Hoshikawa, Senior Writer Sheen Screen SPF 50 Hydrating Lip Balm, $22 “This SPF lip balm came in second place after testing a long list of contenders. The texture is akin to a juicy gloss, but once it’s absorbed, it transforms into a sheer, silky finish that feels weightless rather than gloopy. I often compare it to Rhode’s Peptide Lip Tint in Raspberry Jelly — but with the added bonus of SPF 50. The slightly noticeable taste is a minor drawback, but I’m willing to overlook it for the beautiful tint and the lasting moisture it delivers long after the product wears off.” — Jacqueline Kilikita, Beauty Director Future Screen SPF 50 Modern Mineral Sunscreen, $40 “I’ve avoided mineral sunscreens for years because most leave a heavy, chalky residue that’s impossible to blend. But this one is a game-changer. The texture is unbelievably lightweight — more like a serum than a sunscreen — and it absorbs in seconds without the need for excessive rubbing (which usually just ends up removing the product). With a hint of tint that subtly blurs skin imperfections, it works like a soft-focus filter with a naturally radiant result. It’s so good that I actually look forward to putting it on. In fact, it has replaced Fave Fluid as my ultimate go-to.” — Jacqueline Kilikita, Beauty Director Vibrant Screen SPF 50 Face and Body Sunscreen, $30 “I’m not super picky about the sunscreen I use below the neck, especially since I go through them so quickly living in Florida. Vibrant Screen felt more like an expensive body lotion than SPF, and I’m not surprised it’s already out of stock at Sephora. Alongside chemical UV filters, this sweat- and water-resistant formula is loaded with aloe vera and vitamin E to nourish and soothe skin, making reapplication a joy. I tan easily—which is a good litmus test for sunscreen — and this kept me protected (and the same shade of olive-tan) pre- and post-application. What more could I want from an SPF?” — Karina Hoshikawa, Senior Writer Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?Shark Beauty Perfected the LED MaskIlona Maher On Her Game Day Glam & Go-To SunscreenSPF Makeup Is Trending – Here's How To Try It Out
author: Karina Hoshikawa

title: The 30 Best Skin-Care Products You Can Buy at Ulta
description: Whether you're on the lookout for a simple brightening clay mask or you need to revamp your entire skin-care routine, the world of beauty is endless. We know it can be hard to decide what products are best for your skin concerns, so we narrowed down the must haves at Ulta. The popular beauty retailer carries a variety of our favorite drugstore brands in addition to high-end skin-care items we can't get enough of. We went on a mission and uncovered some of the best skin-care products at Ulta, so all you have to do is shop below. From names like CeraVe and La Roche-Posay to Kiehl's and Peach & Lily, this lineup features everything you could ever want. If you have acne-prone skin, stock up on pimple patches to fight your zits, and get the editor-favorite Kate Somerville EradiKate Acne Mark Fading Gel to treat acne. Diminish dark spots and hyperpigmentation with the Good Molecules Niacinamide Brightening Toner or the Mad Hippie Vitamin C Serum. On the hunt for a new sunscreen? The Live Tinted Hueguard 3-in-1 Broad Spectrum Mineral SPF 30 is an editor-recommended find that doesn't leave a white cast. Shop our top picks ahead.
author: Anvita Reddy

title: The 11 Best Shampoos to Combat Hair Loss
description: Experiencing hair loss can feel frustrating, but thankfully, you are not alone. In fact, it's even normal. According to the American Academy of Dermatology Association, hair loss affects an estimated 80 million Americans, and the average person loses 50 to 100 strands a day. Whether you've experienced changes in your diet, stress levels, or a poor reaction to a chemical treatment, there could be several reasons your hair is thinning or shedding. But here's the good news: hair growth shampoos can make a real difference. Packed with ingredients like biotin, keratin, collagen, and rosemary oil - all known to nourish, strengthen, and lengthen strands - hair growth shampoos promise to help stimulate the hair follicle and promote growth at the root. The right shampoo will help nourish and unclog the hair follicle, while preventing damage. So, if you're experiencing breakage, or your hair simply can't get past the same, stagnant length - the list curated ahead is for you. It's important to remember that Rapunzel-length strands don't happen overnight. Healthy hair grows half an inch a month, so make sure you give the shampoo three to four months to produce noticeable results. Ahead, discover 11 shampoos to aid in your hair growth goals.
author: Natasha Marsh
